data.Name: If the well status indicates production, the on-production date must not be null
data.Description: DEPRECATED: Please use Code="DataQualityRule:PPDM.WellProducing-ProductionDateDefined" with Name="If the well status indicates production, the on-production date must not be null" instead. If a well or wellbore has reported production, there must be a date for the start of this production
data.Code: If the well status indicates production, the on-production date must not be null
data.DataRuleStatement: If WELLBORE.FacilityState indicates production then FacilityEventType.ON_PRODUCTION must be not be null

data.Name: The name of the company that conducted a seismic survey should not be null
data.Description: DEPRECATED: Please use Code="DataQualityRule:PPDM.SeismicAcquisitionSurveyingCompanyDefined" with Name="The name of the company that conducted a seismic survey should not be null" instead. The company that acquired the seismic data in the field is valuable information
data.Code: The name of the company that conducted a seismic survey should not be null
data.DataRuleStatement: SeismicAcquisitionProject.Contractors.ContractorOrganisationID is not null and SeismicAcquisitionProject.ContractorsContractorTypeID = Recording

data.Name: The seismic survey client company should not be null
data.Description: DEPRECATED: Please use Code="DataQualityRule:PPDM.SeismicAcquisitionClientCompanyDefined" with Name="The seismic survey client company should not be null" instead. The company that contracted for the seismic survey is valuable information
data.Code: The seismic survey client company should not be null
data.DataRuleStatement: SeismicAcquisitionProject.Operator is not null

data.Name: If a well has a status of completed, the completion date must not be null
data.Description: DEPRECATED: Please use Code="DataQualityRule:PPDM.WellCompleted-CompletionDateDefined" with Name="If a well has a status of completed, the completion date must not be null" instead. A completion date is necessary information for any completed well
data.Code: If a well has a status of completed, the completion date must not be null
data.DataRuleStatement: If WELLBORE.FacilityState indicates production then FacilityEventType.LAST_COMPLETION must be not be null

data.Name: The geopolitical context for a facility must not be null.
data.Description: DEPRECATED: Please use Code="DataQualityRule:PPDM.FacilityGeoPoliticalContextDefined" with Name="The geopolitical context for a facility must not be null." instead. The name or code for administrative (country), licensing, surveying, or operating area must be populated for any facility.
data.Code: The geopolitical context for a facility must not be null
data.DataRuleStatement: GeoPoliticalContext must not be NULL.

data.Name: Total Depth must be a positive number greater than zero and less than 50,000 feet or 15240 meters.
data.Description: DEPRECATED: Please use Code="DataQualityRule:PPDM.WellTotalDepthIsReasonable" with Name="Total Depth must be a positive number greater than zero and less than 50,000 feet or 15240 meters." instead. Ensure that well total depth is not a negative number and falls within generally agreed upon maximum depth based on technology
data.Code: Total Depth must be a positive number greater than zero and less than 50,000 feet or 15240 meters
data.DataRuleStatement: VerticalMeasurement for a wellbore must be less than 50,000 feet or 15240 meters when VerticalMeasurementType is Total Depth

data.Name: The drilling floor elevation for an offshore well should be between 1 and 40 m.
data.Description: DEPRECATED: Please use Code="DataQualityRule:PPDM.WellOffshoreRelativeDrillFloorElevationIsReasonable" with Name="The drilling floor elevation for an offshore well should be between 1 and 40 m." instead. The drilling floor elevation for an offshore well should be between 1 and 40 m.
data.Code: The drilling floor elevation for an offshore well should be between 1 and 40 m
data.DataRuleStatement: VerticalMeasurement for a wellbore must be between  1 meter and 40 meters if OperatingEnvironment indicates offshore and VerticalMeasurementType is Derrick Floor, Kelly Bushing, or Rotary Table

data.Name: The basin name or code for a well should not be null.
data.Description: DEPRECATED: Please use Code="DataQualityRule:PPDM.WellBasinDefined" with Name="The basin name or code for a well should not be null." instead. The name or code for a geologic basin is useful information for any well
data.Code: The basin name or code for a well should not be null
data.DataRuleStatement: For a well facility the name or code for AbstractGeoBasinContext must not be null

data.Name: The ground elevation must be less than the kelly bushing elevation (KB).
data.Description: DEPRECATED: Please use Code="DataQualityRule:PPDM.WellGroundLevelLessThanKellyBushing" with Name="The ground elevation must be less than the kelly bushing elevation (KB)." instead. The kelly bushing (KB) is a part of the drilling rig and therefore is always above the ground surface.
data.Code: The ground elevation must be less than the kelly bushing elevation (KB)
data.DataRuleStatement: VerticalMeasurementType Ground Level must be less than VerticalMeasurementType Kelly Bushing

data.Name: Ground elevation should be less than 2000 m. Remark: Make it a bigger number, to be on the safe side
data.Description: DEPRECATED: Please use Code="DataQualityRule:PPDM.WellGroundLevelIsReasonable" with Name="Ground elevation should be less than 2000 m. Remark: Make it a bigger number, to be on the safe side" instead. The elevation must be reasonable for the well's geographic locality
data.Code: Ground elevation should be less than 2000 m. Remark: Make it a bigger number, to be on the safe side
data.DataRuleStatement: VerticalMeasurement for a wellbore must be less than 2000 meters when VerticalMeasurementType is Ground Level

data.Name: Well location type should not be null. Remark: with enum = INFORMATION
data.Description: DEPRECATED: Please use Code="DataQualityRule:PPDM.WellLocationTypeDefined" with Name="Well location type should not be null. Remark: with enum = INFORMATION" instead. A location associated with a well could be any point in 3D space, on the surface or in the subsurface. The geographic coordinates or other survey information for a well should be explicitly connected to a type of location e.g. well origin, subsea slot.
data.Code: Well location type should not be null. Remark: with enum = INFORMATION
data.DataRuleStatement: For a well AbstractSpatialLocation must be populated

data.Name: Well profile type should not be null. Remark: with enum = INFORMATION
data.Description: DEPRECATED: Please use Code="DataQualityRule:PPDM.WellboreProfileTypeDefined" with Name="Well profile type should not be null. Remark: with enum = INFORMATION" instead. The well profile described the general construction of a well or wellbore, e.g. vertical, deviated, horizontal
data.Code: Well profile type should not be null. Remark: with enum = INFORMATION
data.DataRuleStatement: For a wellbore TrajectoryType must not be null for drilled wellbores

data.Name: The well spud date should be later than year 1900.
data.Description: DEPRECATED: Please use Code="DataQualityRule:PPDM.WellSpudDateLaterThan1900" with Name="The well spud date should be later than year 1900." instead. This is a simple test for to check for an obvious error in date format or range. It is a range validity rule. A date before 1859 is probably a data entry error or a date format error. The rule can be adapted to a specific region where the date of the earliest well is known, e.g. Ohio 1859, Norway 1966.
data.Code: The well spud date should be later than year 1900
data.DataRuleStatement: For a well FacilityEventType any date must not be before year 1900 and not later than year 2100

data.Name: Spud date must be less than current date
data.Description: DEPRECATED: Please use Code="DataQualityRule:PPDM.WellSpudDateIsReasonable" with Name="Spud date must be less than current date" instead. The start of drilling (spud) is always a past event, unless predicted at the planning stage
data.Code: Spud date must be less than current date
data.DataRuleStatement: For a well FacilityEventType Spud must not be later than current date

data.Name: Spud date must be less than rig release date.
data.Description: DEPRECATED: Please use Code="DataQualityRule:PPDM.WellRigReleaseDateYoungerThanSpudDate" with Name="Spud date must be less than rig release date." instead. The rule checks for the logical sequence of dates. The drilling rig cannot be released until after drilling has started (spud.)
data.Code: Spud date must be less than rig release date
data.DataRuleStatement: For a well FacilityEventType Spud must be less than FacilityEventType Rig Release

data.Name: Well final drill date should be greater than 1900
data.Description: DEPRECATED: Please use Code="DataQualityRule:PPDM.WellFinalDrillDateLaterThan1900" with Name="Well final drill date should be greater than 1900" instead. A date that is too old is an indicator of bad data. The date should be adjusted to the locality of interest
data.Code: Well final drill date should be greater than 1900
data.DataRuleStatement: For a well FacilityEventType TD Reached must be later than 1900

data.Name: Well name should not be null
data.Description: DEPRECATED: Please use Code="DataQualityRule:PPDM.WellNameIsDefined" with Name="Well name should not be null" instead. Most wells are labelled with a name even if they also have other identifiers
data.Code: Well name should not be null
data.DataRuleStatement: FacilityName must not be null

data.Name: Seismic acquisition start date is less than completed date
data.Description: DEPRECATED: Please use Code="DataQualityRule:PPDM.SeismicAcquisitionDatesConsistent" with Name="Seismic acquisition start date is less than completed date" instead. As in all date pairs, the start date is less than the end date
data.Code: Seismic acquisition start date is less than completed date
data.DataRuleStatement: SeismicAcquisitionProject.ProjectBeginDate < SeismicAcquisitionProject.ProjectEndDate

data.Name: For a group of seismic points, the datum to which the elevations or depths have been referenced should be recorded.
data.Description: DEPRECATED: Please use Code="DataQualityRule:PPDM.SeismicReferenceElevationDefined" with Name="For a group of seismic points, the datum to which the elevations or depths have been referenced should be recorded." instead. Seismic point groups should have the reference datum specified.
data.Code: For a group of seismic points, the datum to which the elevations or depths have been referenced should be recorded
data.DataRuleStatement: if SeismicTraceData.VerticalDatumOffset is not null then SeismicTraceData.VerticalMeasurementTypeID is not null

data.Name: In defining a seismic bin grid each corner must have a latitude and a longitude
data.Description: DEPRECATED: Please use Code="DataQualityRule:PPDM.SeismicBinGridCornerPointsDefined" with Name="In defining a seismic bin grid each corner must have a latitude and a longitude" instead. As a minimum set of spatial information about a geographic area, the key locations should be reported. A rectangular bin grid can be defined by 3 corners. The details of the shape and extent may be stored elsewhere.
data.Code: In defining a seismic bin grid each corner must have a latitude and a longitude
data.DataRuleStatement: Count( SeismicBinGrid.ABCDBinGridSpatialLocation.Coordinates ) = 4

data.Name: The end time of a seismic activity must have the time zone.
data.Description: DEPRECATED: Please use Code="DataQualityRule:PPDM.SeismicActivityEndTimeTimeZoneDefined" with Name="The end time of a seismic activity must have the time zone." instead. Clock time can be wrong or uncertain without the time zone.
data.Code: The end time of a seismic activity must have the time zone
data.DataRuleStatement: if match (SeismicProcessingProject.ProjectEndDate, "T") then match( SeismicProcessingProject.ProjectEndDate, "T*[Z-]" )

data.Name: The inline minimum number for a seismic bin grid is less than the inline maximum number
data.Description: DEPRECATED: Please use Code="DataQualityRule:PPDM.SeismicBinGridMinInlineLessThanMaxInline" with Name="The inline minimum number for a seismic bin grid is less than the inline maximum number" instead. For any value tracked, the minimum should be less than the average which is less than the maximum
data.Code: The inline minimum number for a seismic bin grid is less than the inline maximum number
data.DataRuleStatement: SeismicBinGrid.ABCDBinGridLocalCoordinates.Coordinates.X[0] = SeismicBinGrid.ABCDBinGridLocalCoordinates.Coordinates.X[1] and SeismicBinGrid.ABCDBinGridLocalCoordinates.Coordinates.X[1] < SeismicBinGrid.ABCDBinGridLocalCoordinates.Coordinates.X[2] and SeismicBinGrid.ABCDBinGridLocalCoordinates.Coordinates.X[2] = SeismicBinGrid.ABCDBinGridLocalCoordinates.Coordinates.X[3] and SeismicBinGrid.ABCDBinGridLocalCoordinates.Coordinates.Y[0] < SeismicBinGrid.ABCDBinGridLocalCoordinates.Coordinates.X[1] and SeismicBinGrid.ABCDBinGridLocalCoordinates.Coordinates.Y[1] > SeismicBinGrid.ABCDBinGridLocalCoordinates.Coordinates.X[2] and SeismicBinGrid.ABCDBinGridLocalCoordinates.Coordinates.Y[0] < SeismicBinGrid.ABCDBinGridLocalCoordinates.Coordinates.X[1] and SeismicBinGrid.ABCDBinGridLocalCoordinates.Coordinates.Y[2] < SeismicBinGrid.ABCDBinGridLocalCoordinates.Coordinates.X[3]

data.Name: A seismic bin grid angle of rotation is less than 360 degrees.
data.Description: DEPRECATED: Please use Code="DataQualityRule:PPDM.BinGridRotationRange" with Name="A seismic bin grid angle of rotation is less than 360 degrees." instead. The bin grid orientation can be related to the map grid North by the clockwise rotation of the J axis.
data.Code: A seismic bin grid angle of rotation is less than 360 degrees
data.DataRuleStatement: SeismicBinGrid.P6MapGridBearingOfBinGridJAxis >=0 and SeismicBinGrid.P6MapGridBearingOfBinGridJAxis < 360

data.Name: PPDM
data.Description: DEPRECATED: this is an unusable rule.
data.Code: PPDM
data.DataRuleStatement: VerticalMeasurement for a wellbore must be less than 3000 meters if OperatingEnvironment indicates onshore and VerticalMeasurementType is Derrick Floor, Kelly Bushing, or Rotary Table
